intro: Sorbus veszpremensis, commonly known as the Veszprém rowan, is a shrub or small tree native to Hungary. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its pinnately compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are a food source for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native region.
